MINUTES: ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE REGARDING DISMISSAL FOR LACK OF PROSECTION; IT IS ORDERED that plaintiffs counsel show cause in writing not later than 5/12/06 why this action should not be dismissed for lack of prosecution as to defendant(s) all named defendants in the above referenced cases. No oral argument will be heard on this matter unless ordered by the Court. Order to Show Cause will stand submitted upon the filing of plaintiff(s) response. Court will consider as a satisfactory response the filing of the following on or before the date shown above: Answer by defendants All Named defendants or plaintiff(s) request for entry of default, Stipulation and Order extending time to respond to complaint failure to file a timely response is deemed consent to the dismissal without prejudice of the action as to the above defendants by Judge Audrey B. Collins Court Reporter: Not reported. (ir, ) (Entered: 04/17/2006)

IT IS ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED that Plaintiff Robb Evans, as Receiver over the assets of James P. Lewis, Jr., individually and doing business as Financial Advisory Consultants, Income Fund, Ltd. and Growth Fund, Ltd., is awarded a joint and several judgment against Defendants Jaime D. Gomez-Marinelli and Rosa Gomez in the amount of $10,000.00, together with postjudgment interest pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 1961 from the date of entry of judgment until paid in full at the rate provided by such statute. MINUTES: ORDER TO PLAINTIFF TO SUBMIT STATUS REPORT (In Chambers) The Court notes that Plaintiff Robb Evans, as Receiver over the Assets of James P. Lewis, Jr., has not filed any dispositive motions in the above-referenced cases. Over the law few days, Plaintiff did, however, file motions for summary judgment in six other cases related to SEC v James P. Lewis, Jr., CV-03-9354-ABC-VBK. The deadline for filing motions in all of these cases was August 11, 2008. The Court hereby ORDERS Plaintiff to file a status report for each of the four cases in which no motions were filed, identifying which defendants remain in the case, and explaining Plaintiffs anticipated course of litigation with respect to those defendants. These reports must be filed no later than Friday, August 22, 2008, and may be filed under seal IT IS SO ORDERED by Judge Audrey B. Collins (ir) (Entered: 08/14/2008)

JUDGMENT by Judge Audrey B. Collins against Defendants James L. Copeland and Lillian McGrath, individually and as Trustee of the Lillian McGrath Revocable Living Trust after Default. IT IS ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED that Plaintiff Robb Evans as Receiver of the assets of James P. Lewis, Jr., individually and doing business as Financial Advisory Consultants, Income Fund, Ltd. and Growth Fund, Ltd., shall have judgment against defendant James L. Copeland in the principal amount of $27,971.00, together with pre-judgment interest on said sum in the amount of $3,760.84, plus costs of suit herein is awarded in the sum of $82.50, for a total judgment in the amount of $31,814.34. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED, ADJUDGED AND DECREED that Plaintiff Robb Evans as Receiver of the assets of James P. Lewis, Jr., individually and doing business as Financial Advisory Consultants, Income Fund, Ltd. and Growth Fund, Ltd., shall have judgment against defendant Lillian S. McGrath, individually and as Trustee of the Lillian McGrath Revocable Living Trust in the principal amount of $73,800.00, together with pre-judgment interest in the amount of $9,920.06, plus costs of suit herein is awarded in the sum of $82.50, for a total judgment in the amount of $83,802.56. Grand totals prinicipal $101,771.00; interest in the amount of $13,680.09; costs of $165.00 for a grantd total judgment of $115,616.90. Related to: APPLICATION for Default Judgment 113 . (mg) (Entered: 02/09/2009)
